attributes.action: Include the Brixton Street Gym in the redevelopment projects of Somerleyton Road
attributes.additional_details: Recently, Lambeth Council have planned to rebuild Somerleyton Road as part of a redevelopment project. At this moment, no public information has been released on the future of the Brixton Street Gym and whether or not it has been formally included in the Council’s development plans. On Friday 14 April, 2017, members of the gym had their access to the premises denied without due warning and large chains were put on the gym’s gates.
attributes.background: Lambeth Council have decided to shut down Brixton Street Gym due to redevelopment plans, which works with unprivileged communities and youths on the fringe of crime. Closing this gym will have unimaginable effects on the community. Brixton Street Gym must be included in the redevelopment plans.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here:

https://www.lambeth.gov.uk/elections-and-council/meetings-minutes-and-agendas/submit-a-petition
